meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted an electrophoretic experiment to separate the molecules.
meanings.sent2: The electrophoretic process helped identify the different components of the mixture.
meanings.sent3: The electrophoretic gel danced as the molecules moved through it.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts raced like an electrophoretic process, sorting through ideas quickly.
meanings.sent5: The electrophoretic technique painted a clear picture of the molecular structure.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the movement of charged particles in an electric field.
meanings.sent1: The electrophoretic motion of the particles was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: An electrophoretic field was used to guide the charged particles in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The electrophoretic particles seemed to dance in response to the electric field.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like an electrophoretic charge, spreading quickly through the room.
meanings.sent5: The electrophoretic behavior of the particles was like a choreographed dance in the electric field.

meanings.definition: Used in or produced by electrophoresis.
meanings.sent1: The electrophoretic equipment was essential for the laboratory experiment.
meanings.sent2: An electrophoretic device was used to analyze the DNA samples.
meanings.sent3: The electrophoretic machine hummed softly as it separated the molecules.
meanings.sent4: Her voice carried an electrophoretic tone, resonating with clarity.
meanings.sent5: The electrophoretic tool efficiently separated the different components of the solution.
